meanings.definition: Able to be measured or quantified.
meanings.sent1: The length of the table was mensurable with a ruler.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use tools to make sure things are mensurable in their experiments.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to measure the mensurable distance between the couch and the window.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as mensurable as the depth of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of fractions mensurable by using pizza slices.

meanings.definition: Capable of being compared or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were mensurable in terms of color and size.
meanings.sent2: Students find it easier to understand when things are mensurable in a clear way.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best costume was so fierce that it became mensurable.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was as mensurable as the tallest mountain.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the new policy was made mensurable through data analysis.

meanings.definition: Having a measurable extent or dimension.
meanings.sent1: The mensurable width of the door allowed for easy passage.
meanings.sent2: The mensurable weight of the package was within the limit for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The mensurable size of the cake made it perfect for sharing.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was as mensurable as the vastness of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The mensurable depth of the lake was revealed by sonar technology.
